1.1 Text Alternatives.title: Text Alternatives
1.1 Text Alternatives.description: Provide text alternatives for any non-text content so that it can be changed into other forms people need, such as large print, braille, speech, symbols or simpler language.

1.3 Adaptable.title: Adaptable
1.3 Adaptable.description: Create content that can be presented in different ways (for example simpler layout) without losing information or structure.

1.4 Distinguishable.title: Distinguishable
1.4 Distinguishable.description: Make it easier for users to see and hear content including separating foreground from background.

2.1 Keyboard Accessible.title: Keyboard Accessible
2.1 Keyboard Accessible.description: Make all functionality available from a keyboard.

2.2 Enough Time.title: Enough Time
2.2 Enough Time.description: Provide users enough time to read and use content.

2.3 Seizures.title: Seizures
2.3 Seizures.description: Do not design content in a way that is known to cause seizures.

2.4 Naviguable.title: Naviguable
2.4 Naviguable.description: Provide ways to help users navigate, find content, and determine where they are.

3.1 Readable.title: Readable
3.1 Readable.description: Make text content readable and understandable.

3.2 Predictable.title: Predictable
3.2 Predictable.description: Make Web pages appear and operate in predictable ways.

3.3 Input Assistance.title: Input Assistance
3.3 Input Assistance.description: Help users avoid and correct mistakes.

4.1 Compatible.title: Compatible
4.1 Compatible.description: Maximize compatibility with current and future user agents, including assistive technologies.
